paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician upon Shoshannim, for the sons of Korah, Maschil, A Song of loves.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician upon Shoshannim, for the sons of Korah, Maschil, A Song of loves.

paragraphs.content: My heart is inditing a good matter: I speak of the things which I have made touching the king: my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My heart is inditing a good matter: I speak of the things which I have made touching the king: my tongue is the pen of a ready writer.

paragraphs.content: Thou art fairer than the children of men: grace is poured into thy lips: therefore God hath blessed thee for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou art fairer than the children of men: grace is poured into thy lips: therefore God hath blessed thee for ever.

paragraphs.content: Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O most mighty, with thy glory and thy majesty.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Gird thy sword upon thy thigh, O most mighty, with thy glory and thy majesty.

paragraphs.content: And in thy majesty ride prosperously because of truth and meekness and righteousness; and thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And in thy majesty ride prosperously because of truth and meekness and righteousness; and thy right hand shall teach thee terrible things.

paragraphs.content: Thine arrows are sharp in the heart of the king’s enemies; whereby the people fall under thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thine arrows are sharp in the heart of the king’s enemies; whereby the people fall under thee.

paragraphs.content: Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: the sceptre of thy kingdom is a right sceptre.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: the sceptre of thy kingdom is a right sceptre.

paragraphs.content: Thou lovest righteousness, and hatest wickedness: therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou lovest righteousness, and hatest wickedness: therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.

paragraphs.content: All thy garments smell of myrrh, and aloes, and cassia, out of the ivory palaces, whereby they have made thee glad.
paragraphs.contentHtml: All thy garments smell of myrrh, and aloes, and cassia, out of the ivory palaces, whereby they have made thee glad.

paragraphs.content: Kings’ daughters were among thy honourable women: upon thy right hand did stand the queen in gold of Ophir.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Kings’ daughters were among thy honourable women: upon thy right hand did stand the queen in gold of Ophir.

paragraphs.content: Hearken, O daughter, and consider, and incline thine ear; forget also thine own people, and thy father’s house;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hearken, O daughter, and consider, and incline thine ear; forget also thine own people, and thy father’s house;

paragraphs.content: So shall the king greatly desire thy beauty: for he is thy Lord; and worship thou him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: So shall the king greatly desire thy beauty: for he is thy Lord; and worship thou him.

paragraphs.content: And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift; even the rich among the people shall entreat thy favour.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the daughter of Tyre shall be there with a gift; even the rich among the people shall entreat thy favour.

paragraphs.content: The king’s daughter is all glorious within: her clothing is of wrought gold.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The king’s daughter is all glorious within: her clothing is of wrought gold.

paragraphs.content: She shall be brought unto the king in raiment of needlework: the virgins her companions that follow her shall be brought unto thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She shall be brought unto the king in raiment of needlework: the virgins her companions that follow her shall be brought unto thee.

paragraphs.content: With gladness and rejoicing shall they be brought: they shall enter into the king’s palace.
paragraphs.contentHtml: With gladness and rejoicing shall they be brought: they shall enter into the king’s palace.

paragraphs.content: Instead of thy fathers shall be thy children, whom thou mayest make princes in all the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Instead of thy fathers shall be thy children, whom thou mayest make princes in all the earth.

paragraphs.content: I will make thy name to be remembered in all generations: therefore shall the people praise thee for ever and ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will make thy name to be remembered in all generations: therefore shall the people praise thee for ever and ever.
